content: The RTX 4080 is in a great performance bracket, and with an overclock, it makes it a pretty good value.
The RTX 4080 Super doesn't have big performance improvements over the RTX 4080 but it has a better price.
The Nvidia GeForce RTX 4080 is a cool and quiet 4K gaming monster, it is a great card.
The NVIDIA GeForce RTX 4080 is faster than expected and much more frugal than feared, it is a really solid card.
The Nvidia GeForce RTX 4080 has great design and features, and is faster than the 3090 Ti, a fantastic card.
The ASUS GeForce RTX 4080 Super TUF OC has an improved cooling solution, which is great.
The Gigabyte GeForce RTX 4080 Super Gaming OC features a massive cooler, which is pretty impressive.
The ASUS GeForce RTX 4080 Super TUF OC features an improved cooling solution, which is nice.
I do not think that the price difference is really worth it. It is too expensive.
The 4080 is pretty powerful.
The 4080's performance isn't great for the price, especially compared to the 4090. It's hard to see who it's for.
It's good the performance gap between the 4080 and 4090 isn't huge, but the value is still terrible.
The 4080 beats every 30 series card still selling above it. Why should it be cheaper?
The 4080 is a lose at this price. They need a lesson and I hope this fails.
I'm glad I kept my 3090Ti. The 4080 isn't worth it for the minimal FPS gains.
The 4080 is over 70% more expensive but only provides 50% more performance.
The 4080's performance is crap for the price, not worth it even with DLSS 3.
Way too expensive. Nvidia is pretending the crypto boom never ended.
The 4080 isn't a good deal at that price. The RX 7900 XTX is more powerful for less.
This generation is a non-event for me. The 4080 is priced ridiculously out of whack.
Looks like a great option to replace my 1080ti, but I can't swallow $1200+.
It needs to be cheaper to be preferred. Ray tracing is worth $214.
Nvidia tech is vastly superior to AMD, especially in picture quality and upscaling.
Best values are the 4070 and openbox 4070ti. AMD is only worth it without CUDA.
The performance is very good, but prices make it impossible to appreciate.
I'd gladly trade my 7900XTX for a 4080 due to constant driver timeouts.
